title: Data Scientists beware of the new world!

data.content: A framework to solve analytical problems in the era of COVID19 based on perturbation theory.

Data science is a humbling exercise as most of the time, hours of creative and thoughtful modeling will result in disappointing results in the face of reality since reality doesn’t care about our models.
I expect that in the upcoming months and years we should be more careful when we go through analytical exercises and model building.
Particularly, how are we going to handle the perturbation to the data generating distribution function?
A framework to think about the world, before/after COVID19
To understand the impact of this perturbation you can break your time axis into four phases:
Be Cautious but when life gives you a lemon, size/seize the lemonade opportunity

While these perturbations are going to throw a wrench in your modeling/analysis, but you should also keep an open eye. The world has changed and nobody truly knows in what way which means we are in a fertile ground for new opportunities and business models.
With that being said in your future analytical work be more cautious:
What was the impact of COVID19 on your day to day job? How do you think your world has changed?
